channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Several trees, 12th June
item.description:
Trees are extremely high and they are dropping huge branches. The tree are teller than my home, i am extremely worried they will cause damage as the branches that are falling are really big. They are swaying alot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, North End, London

item.title: Broken lime bike dumped blocking our path, 12th June
item.description:
Line bike dumped on our path. It had no handlebars and it's to heavy to move it's dangerous and people keep tripping over it. It's blocking access to our bin sheds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawthorn Grove, Anerley, London

item.title: Trees, 12th June
item.description:
There are several TREES to the rear of residents house in an alley way they are taller than her house and they keep dropping large branches not sure who owns the land but needs the council to support with this, the tree is swaying in the wind and could fall completely and she is very concerned, could an inspection be done and resident advised. as some of the large branches are falling into the garden and is very dangerous .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping still not fixed and more stuff dumped, 12th June
item.description:
It seems that Hackney Council did not fully deal with the previous fly tipping of industrial waste. All the blue drums have still remained from 2 weeks back. Now more fly tipping rubbish has appeared in the same location.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cadogan Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rats around recycling bins, 12th June
item.description:
Sighting of rats around recycling bins. Unsurprising given daily fly tipping of household waste however this poses a health and safety risk as in such close proximity to residential homes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Weighton Road, Anerley, London

item.title: Bus mirror struck small tree, 12th June
item.description:
A bus struck a small tree on Denmark Hill opposite 127 Denmark Hill. This tree along with a few other bits of maintenance to Trees prior to this specific one and a hedge could do with trimming back. I have placed a small cone and taped the specific tree in question for identification purposes. Please can this be done at your earliest convenience as the bus lane would provide spaces for council vehicles to be parked and also allowed for traffic flow on the offside of this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blanchedowne, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside nos 55 and 56 Hatton Garden, 12th June
item.description:
A n access cover in the pavement (labelled Post Office telephones) is broken. Temporary barriers were erected but have been laying on the pavement for about 1 month. This is a hazard to pedestrians and contrary to your Safe Streets policy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Hatton Garden, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
